      "ref": "01KF16XG",
      "text": "Hook for SessionStart or post-compaction to inject relevant context and subtle instructions. Could auto-run 'kspec session start' or similar to give agent fresh context after memory is compacted.",
      "created_at": "2026-01-15T16:13:16.998Z",
      "tags": [],
      "added_by": "@claude"
    },
    {
      "ref": "01KF1V53",
      "text": "Spec review process: 3 parallel agents (internal fit, prior art comparison, external research) before finalizing major specs. Worked well for shadow branch spec design - should be formalized in meta-spec workflows.",
      "created_at": "2026-01-15T22:06:57.823Z",
      "tags": [
        "workflow",
        "meta"
      ],
      "added_by": "@claude"
    },
    {
      "ref": "01KF3PJW",
      "text": "CLI output parity - JSON and human-readable outputs can drift when adding features. Investigate patterns to keep them in sync by design: unified output formatter, schema-driven rendering, shared data structure that both modes consume. Current pattern: output(data, humanFormatter) - data goes to JSON, formatter handles human. But formatter can show derived/computed info that isn't in data.",
      "created_at": "2026-01-16T15:25:35.193Z",
      "tags": [
        "cli",
        "dx",
        "design"
      ],
      "added_by": "@claude"
    },
    {
      "ref": "01KF4DS5",
      "text": "Investigate ready task ordering beyond priority - creation order may not be ideal. Consider: recency of notes/activity, dependency depth, spec item priority inheritance, manual ordering field, tags for urgency",
      "created_at": "2026-01-16T22:10:58.273Z",
      "tags": [
        "design",
        "tasks",
        "dx"
      ],
      "added_by": "@claude"
    },
    {
      "ref": "01KF554T",
      "text": "Ralph Wiggum / Looper Mode - Create a kspec-integrated autonomous loop runner. Core idea: a script that runs Claude Code repeatedly with fresh context, using a templated prompt that instructs it to:\n\n1. Run 'kspec session start' to see ready tasks\n2. Pick a well-defined task (high priority, clear spec, no blockers)\n3. Work on it until completion or stuck\n4. Commit and complete the task\n5. Exit cleanly (the outer loop restarts with fresh context)\n\nKey features from research:\n- Simple core: while :; do cat PROMPT.md | claude ; done\n- Context persists via filesystem/git, not session memory\n- Dual-condition exit: require both completion indicator AND explicit exit signal\n- Circuit breaker: stop after N loops with no progress or repeated errors\n- Rate limiting for API calls\n\nKspec-specific additions:\n- Task selection heuristics (prioritize: clear AC, no blockers, isolated scope)\n- Progress tracking via task notes before each exit\n- Session checkpoint before exit to ensure clean state\n- Maybe: task budget (only attempt tasks under estimated N turns)\n\nThe beauty is each iteration starts fresh but inherits cumulative work. Bad iterations don't compound context - they just waste one run.",
      "created_at": "2026-01-17T04:59:17.160Z",
      "tags": [
        "automation",
        "workflow",
        "agents"
      ],
      "added_by": "@claude"
    },
    {
      "ref": "01KF6541",
      "text": "Ralph TUI mode: Optional terminal UI for ralph that provides real-time visualization of agent progress, event stream, session status. Would build on streaming/ACP foundation. Lower priority than core auditability work.",
      "created_at": "2026-01-17T14:18:06.435Z",
      "tags": [
        "ralph",
        "tui",
        "optional"
      ],
      "added_by": "@claude"
    },
    {
      "ref": "01KF8TQ5",
      "text": "Transaction/batch mechanics for kspec operations - ability to set a mark point where changes don't auto-commit until a final 'commit' call. Could help with bulk operations, rollback on errors, and atomic multi-item changes. Challenges: managing state across commands, cleanup on abandoned transactions, shadow branch implications. Maybe simpler approach: explicit 'kspec bulk' command that takes a script/list of operations and executes them atomically.",
      "created_at": "2026-01-18T15:14:02.282Z",
      "tags": [
        "idea",
        "cli",
        "architecture"
      ],
      "added_by": "@claude"
    },
    {
      "ref": "01KFA1Q5",
      "text": "Phase 1: Implement structured error codes and recovery hints for CLI - define CliError type, map existing error() calls to structured codes, add recovery suggestions for common error scenarios",
      "created_at": "2026-01-19T02:35:36.152Z",
      "tags": [

    {
      "ref": "01KFA1Q9",
      "text": "Phase 1: Implement unified output envelope for JSON mode - wrap all JSON responses in consistent structure with success/data/metadata/error fields",
      "created_at": "2026-01-19T02:35:40.491Z",

## Instructions

Run the task-work skill in loop mode:

```
/task-work loop
```

Loop mode means: no confirmations, auto-resolve decisions, automation-eligible tasks only.

Exit when task work is complete or no eligible tasks remain.

availableCommands.name: audit
availableCommands.description: Comprehensive codebase audit for release readiness. Parallel exploration of docs, code, config, tests, and specs to identify cruft, then interactive triage with clear action options. (project)

availableCommands.name: create-workflow
availableCommands.description: Create new workflows with consistent structure and matching skill integration. Meta-workflow for formalizing patterns into trackable processes. (project)

availableCommands.name: kspec
availableCommands.description: Use kspec CLI for task and spec management. Invoke when working with tasks, tracking work, capturing ideas, checking session status, or managing specs in this project. (project)

availableCommands.name: local-review
availableCommands.description: Pre-PR quality review - verify AC coverage, test quality, E2E preference, and test isolation. (project)

availableCommands.name: meta
availableCommands.description: Manage session context - focus, threads, questions, and observations. Use when tracking what you're working on, managing parallel work streams, or capturing friction points. (project)

availableCommands.name: pr
availableCommands.description: Create a pull request from current work. Handles branch creation, commits, push, and PR creation. Detects branch protection and guides through the PR workflow. (project)

availableCommands.name: pr-review
availableCommands.description: Review and merge a PR with quality gates. Verifies AC coverage and spec alignment before merge. Used in subagent context. (project)

availableCommands.name: reflect
availableCommands.description: Reflect on a session to identify learnings, friction points, and improvements. Captures valuable insights for future sessions and system evolution. (project)

availableCommands.name: release
availableCommands.description: Create versioned releases - bump version via PR, tag, create GitHub release. CI publishes to npm. (project)

availableCommands.name: spec
availableCommands.description: Specification management - creating, organizing, and maintaining spec items with acceptance criteria and traits. (project)

availableCommands.name: spec-plan
availableCommands.description: Translate an approved plan into specs with acceptance criteria and derived tasks. Use after plan mode when transitioning to implementation. (project)

availableCommands.name: task-work
availableCommands.description: Work on a kspec task with proper lifecycle - verify, start, note, submit, PR, complete. (project)

availableCommands.name: triage
availableCommands.description: Triage inbox items systematically. Analyzes items against spec/tasks, categorizes them, and processes using spec-first approach with plan mode for larger features. (project)

availableCommands.name: compact
availableCommands.description: Clear conversation history but keep a summary in context. Optional: /compact [instructions for summarization]

availableCommands.name: init
availableCommands.description: Initialize a new CLAUDE.md file with codebase documentation

availableCommands.name: pr-comments
availableCommands.description: Get comments from a GitHub pull request

availableCommands.name: review
availableCommands.description: Review a pull request

availableCommands.name: security-review
availableCommands.description: Complete a security review of the pending changes on the current branch

OK Completed step 1/9: [action] Filter to automation-eligible tasks only.
Use: kspec tasks ready --eligible
This ensures only tasks marked automation: eligible are considered.


Step 2/9: [decision] Select task by priority order.
Check in order:
1. in_progress tasks (continue existing work)
2. Ready tasks that unblock others (high impact)
3. Highest priority ready task (lowest number = higher priority)

Note: pending_review tasks are handled externally by ralph spawning PR review subagents.

â”€â”€â”€ Spec Context â”€â”€â”€
Multi-Directory Daemon Architecture
Type: feature
Implementation: in_progress
Description:
  Extends the daemon server to support multiple kspec projects simultaneously from a single
  daemon process. Projects are identified via X-Kspec-Dir HTTP header. Enables E2E testing
  with isolated fixtures and multi-project development workflows.
  
  Key architectural changes:
  - Global daemon with PID/port files at ~/.config/kspec/
  - Project context caching with on-demand registration
  - Per-project file watchers
  - WebSocket connections bound to specific projects
  
  BREAKING CHANGE: PID/port files move from .kspec/.daemon.pid to ~/.config/kspec/daemon.pid
Acceptance Criteria:
  [ac-1]
    Given: daemon is running
    When: request includes X-Kspec-Dir header with valid absolute path
    Then: daemon uses that project's context for the request
  [ac-2]
    Given: daemon started from directory with .kspec/
    When: request has no X-Kspec-Dir header
    Then: daemon uses startup directory's project as default
  [ac-3]
    Given: daemon started from directory without .kspec/
    When: request without X-Kspec-Dir arrives
    Then: return 400 with error "No default project configured. Specify X-Kspec-Dir header."
  [ac-4]
    Given: request specifies unknown project path
    When: path is valid kspec project
    Then: daemon auto-registers and caches project context
  [ac-5]
    Given: request specifies invalid path (no .kspec/)
    When: request processed
    Then: return 400 with error "Invalid kspec project - .kspec/ not found at <path>"
  [ac-6]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir header value
    When: path is relative
    Then: reject with 400 and error "Path must be absolute"
  [ac-7]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir header value
    When: path contains ".." segments
    Then: reject with 400 and error "Path must not contain parent traversal"
  [ac-8]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir header value
    When: normalized path differs from provided path
    Then: use normalized path for registration (resolve "." segments, remove trailing slashes, do NOT resolve symlinks)
  [ac-8b]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir points to path with insufficient read permissions
    When: request processed
    Then: return 403 with error "Permission denied - cannot read <path>"
  [ac-9]
    Given: no daemon running
    When: kspec serve start runs from any directory
    Then: daemon starts and writes PID to ~/.config/kspec/daemon.pid and port to ~/.config/kspec/daemon.port
  [ac-9b]
    Given: ~/.config/kspec/ does not exist
    When: daemon starts
    Then: create directory with mode 0755 before writing PID/port files
  [ac-9c]
    Given: ~/.config/kspec/daemon.port exists but contains invalid content
    When: CLI reads port
    Then: return error "Invalid daemon port file" and suggest "kspec serve stop && kspec serve start"
  [ac-10]
    Given: daemon running on port 3456
    When: kspec serve start runs from different directory
    Then: command exits with success and outputs "Daemon already running on port 3456" (no second instance started)
  [ac-10b]
    Given: two kspec serve start commands run concurrently (neither has written PID yet)
    When: both check for running daemon
    Then: only one daemon starts (use file lock on PID file)
  [ac-11]
    Given: daemon running
    When: kspec serve stop runs from any directory
    Then: daemon stops and removes global PID and port files
  [ac-12]
    Given: daemon running
    When: kspec serve status runs
    Then: shows daemon status with port, uptime, and list of registered projects with their paths
  [ac-13]
    Given: CLI needs to connect to daemon
    When: daemon is running
    Then: CLI reads port from ~/.config/kspec/daemon.port
  [ac-14]
    Given: daemon restarts
    When: first request for a project arrives
    Then: project is re-registered automatically (same as initial registration)
  [ac-15]
    Given: daemon running with registered projects
    When: daemon restarts
    Then: registered project list is empty (no persistence across restarts)
  [ac-16]
    Given: two concurrent requests for unregistered project with same path
    When: processed
    Then: both succeed and share the same registered project context (no duplicate watchers)
  [ac-17]
    Given: project is registered
    When: files change in project's .kspec/
    Then: file watcher triggers events scoped to that project
  [ac-18]
    Given: multiple projects registered
    When: Project A changes
    Then: only Project A's WebSocket subscribers receive updates
  [ac-19]
    Given: project watcher creation fails due to OS limits (ulimit)
    When: error occurs
    Then: project registration fails with 503 and error "Unable to watch project - resource limit reached"
  [ac-20]
    Given: registered project's .kspec/ directory is deleted
    When: next request arrives for that project
    Then: return 404 and unregister project automatically
  [ac-21]
    Given: WebSocket client connects with X-Kspec-Dir header during handshake
    When: connection established
    Then: connection is bound to that project for its lifetime and only receives events from that project
  [ac-21b]
    Given: WebSocket connection is established and bound to project
    When: client attempts to change project
    Then: project binding is immutable - client must disconnect and reconnect with new header
  [ac-22]
    Given: WebSocket client connects without X-Kspec-Dir header
    When: default project exists
    Then: connection is bound to default project
  [ac-23]
    Given: WebSocket client connects without X-Kspec-Dir header
    When: no default project
    Then: connection is rejected with close code 4000 and reason "No project specified"
  [ac-24]
    Given: multi-project mode
    When: any API endpoint is called
    Then: response data is scoped to the request's project (no cross-project data leakage)
  [ac-25]
    Given: web UI loads
    When: more than one project registered
    Then: project selector is shown listing all registered projects
  [ac-26]
    Given: user selects project in UI
    When: selection changes
    Then: all subsequent API requests include that project's path in X-Kspec-Dir header
  [ac-27]
    Given: UI is showing project data
    When: different project selected
    Then: UI reloads data from newly selected project
  [ac-28]
    Given: GET /api/projects
    When: called
    Then: returns list of registered projects with paths, registration time, and watcher status
  [ac-29]
    Given: POST /api/projects
    When: called with {path string} body
    Then: manually registers a project (for explicit registration use cases)
  [ac-30]
    Given: DELETE /api/projects/:encodedPath
    When: called
    Then: unregisters project and stops its file watcher
  [ac-8c]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir header contains symlinked path
    When: path resolves to same directory as another registered project via symlink
    Then: paths are treated as separate projects (symlinks are NOT resolved during normalization)
  [ac-20b]
    Given: daemon started from directory with .kspec/ which is later deleted
    When: request without X-Kspec-Dir arrives after default project .kspec/ deleted
    Then: return 400 with error 'Default project no longer valid. Specify X-Kspec-Dir header.'
  [ac-11b]
    Given: daemon is shutting down
    When: shutdown signal received
    Then: all project watchers are stopped and all WebSocket connections are closed before process exits

â”€â”€â”€ Inherited from @trait-localhost-security â”€â”€â”€
  [ac-1] (from @trait-localhost-security)
    Given: server is starting
    When: binding to network interface
    Then: only accepts connections from 127.0.0.1 and ::1 (IPv6 localhost)
  [ac-2] (from @trait-localhost-security)
    Given: connection attempt from non-localhost
    When: request received
    Then: connection rejected with 403 Forbidden
  [ac-3] (from @trait-localhost-security)
    Given: server is configured
    When: configuration allows external binding
    Then: warning displayed about security implications

â”€â”€â”€ Inherited from @trait-websocket-protocol â”€â”€â”€
  [ac-1] (from @trait-websocket-protocol)
    Given: WebSocket connection is established
    When: client connects
    Then: server assigns unique connection ID and sends connected event with session_id
  [ac-2] (from @trait-websocket-protocol)
    Given: client wants notifications
    When: subscribe command sent with topics array
    Then: server tracks subscription and sends ack with request_id
  [ac-3] (from @trait-websocket-protocol)
    Given: client is subscribed to topic
    When: relevant change occurs
    Then: server broadcasts event with format {msg_id, seq, timestamp, topic, event, data}
  [ac-4] (from @trait-websocket-protocol)
    Given: WebSocket connection is active
    When: 30 seconds pass without activity
    Then: server sends ping frame
  [ac-5] (from @trait-websocket-protocol)
    Given: ping was sent
    When: no pong received within 90 seconds
    Then: connection is closed with code 1001
  [ac-6] (from @trait-websocket-protocol)
    Given: server sends events
    When: client cannot keep up (backpressure)
    Then: server pauses non-critical broadcasts until drain event
  [ac-7] (from @trait-websocket-protocol)
    Given: connection is closing
    When: close initiated
    Then: use code 1000 for clean close, 1001 for timeout, 1011 for error
  [ac-8] (from @trait-websocket-protocol)
    Given: client reconnects after disconnect
    When: new connection established
    Then: client resets sequence tracking (lastSeqProcessed = -1) since server generates new sequence

  [ac-1] (from @trait-websocket-protocol)

    Then: connection is closed with code 1001
  [ac-6] (from @trait-websocket-protocol)
    Given: server sends events
    When: client cannot keep up (backpressure)
    Then: server pauses non-critical broadcasts until drain event

    Given: connection is closing

    Then: use code 1000 for clean close, 1001 for timeout, 1011 for error

toolResponse.stdout:
OK Started task: 01KFQAAX

--- Spec Context ---
Implementing: Multi-Directory Daemon Architecture

Extends the daemon server to support multiple kspec projects simultaneously from a single
daemon process. Projects are identified via X-Kspec-Dir HTTP header. Enables E2E testing
with isolated fixtures and multi-project development workflows.

Key architectural changes:
- Global daemon with PID/port files at ~/.config/kspec/
- Project context caching with on-demand registration
- Per-project file watchers
- WebSocket connections bound to specific projects

BREAKING CHANGE: PID/port files move from .kspec/.daemon.pid to ~/.config/kspec/daemon.pid


Acceptance Criteria (38):
  [ac-1]
    Given: daemon is running
    When: request includes X-Kspec-Dir header with valid absolute path
    Then: daemon uses that project's context for the request
  [ac-2]
    Given: daemon started from directory with .kspec/
    When: request has no X-Kspec-Dir header
    Then: daemon uses startup directory's project as default
  [ac-3]
    Given: daemon started from directory without .kspec/
    When: request without X-Kspec-Dir arrives
    Then: return 400 with error "No default project configured. Specify X-Kspec-Dir header."
  [ac-4]
    Given: request specifies unknown project path
    When: path is valid kspec project
    Then: daemon auto-registers and caches project context
  [ac-5]
    Given: request specifies invalid path (no .kspec/)
    When: request processed
    Then: return 400 with error "Invalid kspec project - .kspec/ not found at <path>"
  [ac-6]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir header value
    When: path is relative
    Then: reject with 400 and error "Path must be absolute"
  [ac-7]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir header value
    When: path contains ".." segments
    Then: reject with 400 and error "Path must not contain parent traversal"
  [ac-8]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir header value
    When: normalized path differs from provided path
    Then: use normalized path for registration (resolve "." segments, remove trailing slashes, do NOT resolve symlinks)
  [ac-8b]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir points to path with insufficient read permissions
    When: request processed
    Then: return 403 with error "Permission denied - cannot read <path>"
  [ac-9]
    Given: no daemon running
    When: kspec serve start runs from any directory
    Then: daemon starts and writes PID to ~/.config/kspec/daemon.pid and port to ~/.config/kspec/daemon.port
  [ac-9b]
    Given: ~/.config/kspec/ does not exist
    When: daemon starts
    Then: create directory with mode 0755 before writing PID/port files
  [ac-9c]
    Given: ~/.config/kspec/daemon.port exists but contains invalid content
    When: CLI reads port
    Then: return error "Invalid daemon port file" and suggest "kspec serve stop && kspec serve start"
  [ac-10]
    Given: daemon running on port 3456
    When: kspec serve start runs from different directory
    Then: command exits with success and outputs "Daemon already running on port 3456" (no second instance started)
  [ac-10b]
    Given: two kspec serve start commands run concurrently (neither has written PID yet)
    When: both check for running daemon
    Then: only one daemon starts (use file lock on PID file)
  [ac-11]
    Given: daemon running
    When: kspec serve stop runs from any directory
    Then: daemon stops and removes global PID and port files
  [ac-12]
    Given: daemon running
    When: kspec serve status runs
    Then: shows daemon status with port, uptime, and list of registered projects with their paths
  [ac-13]
    Given: CLI needs to connect to daemon
    When: daemon is running
    Then: CLI reads port from ~/.config/kspec/daemon.port
  [ac-14]
    Given: daemon restarts
    When: first request for a project arrives
    Then: project is re-registered automatically (same as initial registration)
  [ac-15]
    Given: daemon running with registered projects
    When: daemon restarts
    Then: registered project list is empty (no persistence across restarts)
  [ac-16]
    Given: two concurrent requests for unregistered project with same path
    When: processed
    Then: both succeed and share the same registered project context (no duplicate watchers)
  [ac-17]
    Given: project is registered
    When: files change in project's .kspec/
    Then: file watcher triggers events scoped to that project
  [ac-18]
    Given: multiple projects registered
    When: Project A changes
    Then: only Project A's WebSocket subscribers receive updates
  [ac-19]
    Given: project watcher creation fails due to OS limits (ulimit)
    When: error occurs
    Then: project registration fails with 503 and error "Unable to watch project - resource limit reached"
  [ac-20]
    Given: registered project's .kspec/ directory is deleted
    When: next request arrives for that project
    Then: return 404 and unregister project automatically
  [ac-21]
    Given: WebSocket client connects with X-Kspec-Dir header during handshake
    When: connection established
    Then: connection is bound to that project for its lifetime and only receives events from that project
  [ac-21b]
    Given: WebSocket connection is established and bound to project
    When: client attempts to change project
    Then: project binding is immutable - client must disconnect and reconnect with new header
  [ac-22]
    Given: WebSocket client connects without X-Kspec-Dir header
    When: default project exists
    Then: connection is bound to default project
  [ac-23]
    Given: WebSocket client connects without X-Kspec-Dir header
    When: no default project
    Then: connection is rejected with close code 4000 and reason "No project specified"
  [ac-24]
    Given: multi-project mode
    When: any API endpoint is called
    Then: response data is scoped to the request's project (no cross-project data leakage)
  [ac-25]
    Given: web UI loads
    When: more than one project registered
    Then: project selector is shown listing all registered projects
  [ac-26]
    Given: user selects project in UI
    When: selection changes
    Then: all subsequent API requests include that project's path in X-Kspec-Dir header
  [ac-27]
    Given: UI is showing project data
    When: different project selected
    Then: UI reloads data from newly selected project
  [ac-28]
    Given: GET /api/projects
    When: called
    Then: returns list of registered projects with paths, registration time, and watcher status
  [ac-29]
    Given: POST /api/projects
    When: called with {path string} body
    Then: manually registers a project (for explicit registration use cases)
  [ac-30]
    Given: DELETE /api/projects/:encodedPath
    When: called
    Then: unregisters project and stops its file watcher
  [ac-8c]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir header contains symlinked path
    When: path resolves to same directory as another registered project via symlink
    Then: paths are treated as separate projects (symlinks are NOT resolved during normalization)
  [ac-20b]
    Given: daemon started from directory with .kspec/ which is later deleted
    When: request without X-Kspec-Dir arrives after default project .kspec/ deleted
    Then: return 400 with error 'Default project no longer valid. Specify X-Kspec-Dir header.'
  [ac-11b]
    Given: daemon is shutting down
    When: shutdown signal received
    Then: all project watchers are stopped and all WebSocket connections are closed before process exits

Remember: Add test coverage for each AC and mark tests with // AC: @spec-ref ac-N

    Given: daemon started from directory with .kspec/ which is later deleted
    When: request without X-Kspec-Dir arrives after default project .kspec/ deleted
    Then: return 400 with error 'Default project no longer valid. Specify X-Kspec-Dir header.'
  [ac-11b]
    Given: daemon is shutting down
    When: shutdown signal received
    Then: all project watchers are stopped and all WebSocket connections are closed before process exits

Remember: Add test coverage for each AC and mark tests with // AC: @spec-ref ac-N

rawInput.command:
gh pr create --title "test: Add daemon restart and file locking tests" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary

This PR adds comprehensive test coverage for two critical daemon features:

1. **File locking for concurrent daemon start prevention** (AC-10b)
   - Added `lockPidFile()` function using exclusive file locks (`flock` on Unix)
   - Prevents race conditions when multiple `kspec serve start` commands run simultaneously
   - Updated test suite with concurrent start scenarios

2. **Daemon restart behavior tests** (AC-14, AC-15)
   - Added 3 tests for ProjectContextManager restart scenarios
   - Verifies no state persistence across daemon restarts
   - Confirms projects auto-register on first request after restart

## Changes

- `packages/daemon/src/pid.ts`: Added file locking mechanism
- `tests/daemon-global-pid-port.test.ts`: Added concurrent start tests (AC-10b coverage)
- `tests/daemon-context-manager.test.ts`: Added restart scenario tests (AC-14, AC-15 coverage)

## Test Coverage

All tests passing:
- 33 tests in daemon-global-pid-port.test.ts (covering AC-9, AC-9b, AC-9c, AC-10, AC-10b, AC-11, AC-13)
- 32 tests in daemon-context-manager.test.ts (covering AC-1 through AC-8c, AC-14, AC-15, AC-16, AC-20, AC-20b)

## Test Plan

- [x] All existing tests pass
- [x] New file locking tests verify concurrent start prevention
- [x] New restart tests verify state isolation across daemon restarts
- [x] No `test.skip()` calls
- [x] All ACs have corresponding test annotations

Task: @task-context-manager-tests
Spec: @multi-directory-daemon

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)
EOF
)"

toolResponse.stdout:
Inbox (73 items):

  01KF16XG (1 week ago by @claude)
    Hook for SessionStart or post-compaction to inject relevant context and subtle instructions. Could auto-run 'kspec session start' or similar to give agent fresh context after memory is compacted.

  01KF1V53 (1 week ago by @claude) [workflow, meta]
    Spec review process: 3 parallel agents (internal fit, prior art comparison, external research) before finalizing major specs. Worked well for shadow branch spec design - should be formalized in meta-spec workflows.

  01KF3PJW (1 week ago by @claude) [cli, dx, design]
    CLI output parity - JSON and human-readable outputs can drift when adding features. Investigate patterns to keep them in sync by design: unified output formatter, schema-driven rendering, shared data structure that both modes consume. Current pattern: output(data, humanFormatter) - data goes to JSON, formatter handles human. But formatter can show derived/computed info that isn't in data.

  01KF4DS5 (1 week ago by @claude) [design, tasks, dx]
    Investigate ready task ordering beyond priority - creation order may not be ideal. Consider: recency of notes/activity, dependency depth, spec item priority inheritance, manual ordering field, tags for urgency

  01KF554T (1 week ago by @claude) [automation, workflow, agents]
    Ralph Wiggum / Looper Mode - Create a kspec-integrated autonomous loop runner. Core idea: a script that runs Claude Code repeatedly with fresh context, using a templated prompt that instructs it to:

1. Run 'kspec session start' to see ready tasks
2. Pick a well-defined task (high priority, clear spec, no blockers)
3. Work on it until completion or stuck
4. Commit and complete the task
5. Exit cleanly (the outer loop restarts with fresh context)

Key features from research:
- Simple core: while :; do cat PROMPT.md | claude ; done
- Context persists via filesystem/git, not session memory
- Dual-condition exit: require both completion indicator AND explicit exit signal
- Circuit breaker: stop after N loops with no progress or repeated errors
- Rate limiting for API calls

Kspec-specific additions:
- Task selection heuristics (prioritize: clear AC, no blockers, isolated scope)
- Progress tracking via task notes before each exit
- Session checkpoint before exit to ensure clean state
- Maybe: task budget (only attempt tasks under estimated N turns)

The beauty is each iteration starts fresh but inherits cumulative work. Bad iterations don't compound context - they just waste one run.

  01KF6541 (1 week ago by @claude) [ralph, tui, optional]
    Ralph TUI mode: Optional terminal UI for ralph that provides real-time visualization of agent progress, event stream, session status. Would build on streaming/ACP foundation. Lower priority than core auditability work.

  01KF8TQ5 (6 days ago by @claude) [idea, cli, architecture]
    Transaction/batch mechanics for kspec operations - ability to set a mark point where changes don't auto-commit until a final 'commit' call. Could help with bulk operations, rollback on errors, and atomic multi-item changes. Challenges: managing state across commands, cleanup on abandoned transactions, shadow branch implications. Maybe simpler approach: explicit 'kspec bulk' command that takes a script/list of operations and executes them atomically.

  01KFA1Q5 (6 days ago by @claude) [agent-first, cli, phase-1]
    Phase 1: Implement structured error codes and recovery hints for CLI - define CliError type, map existing error() calls to structured codes, add recovery suggestions for common error scenarios

  01KFA1Q9 (6 days ago by @claude) [agent-first, cli, phase-1]
    Phase 1: Implement unified output envelope for JSON mode - wrap all JSON responses in consistent structure with success/data/metadata/error fields

  01KFA1QB (6 days ago by @claude) [agent-first, cli, phase-2]
    Phase 2: Add dry-run support to mutating commands - implement --dry-run flag for task add/set, item add/set/delete, derive, inbox promote. Show preview of changes without executing

  01KFA1QE (6 days ago by @claude) [agent-first, cli, phase-2]
    Phase 2: Add schema introspection commands - kspec help --json-schema, kspec help --exit-codes, kspec help commands --json for programmatic CLI discovery

  01KFBJM1 (5 days ago by @claude) [docs, ralph]
    Review RALPH_LOOP_INSTRUCTIONS.md - consolidate into skills or delete. Unique content: PR review workflow for autonomous loops, 'every iteration ends with PR' rule, reflect guidance for loops. Consider codifying loop-specific reflect behavior into /reflect skill.

  01KFBKA7 (5 days ago by @claude) [docs, spec]
    Review KYNETIC_SPEC_DESIGN.md vs actual .kspec/ spec - identify any gaps/features in design doc not yet in spec before clearing out. Bootstrap doc is now obsolete.

  01KFC3SV (5 days ago by @claude) [cli, dx, bulk]
    Batch command execution via JSON - Generic kspec batch command that accepts JSON array of CLI commands with args. Example: [{"cmd": "item ac add", "ref": "@spec-1", "given": "...", ...}]. Separates concerns: skills/scripts generate the JSON (smart translation), CLI executes it (dumb executor). Supports --dry-run for preview, --file or stdin input. Replaces need for command-specific bulk variants. Pairs with skills that translate intent (plan sections, templates) into batch JSON.

  01KFDQCG (4 days ago by Jacob Chapel)
    Add feature to spawn worktree for an agent to work in

  01KFE2X9 (4 days ago by @claude)
    Ralph loop: Add signal/mechanism for agents to explicitly end the loop when target work is complete (e.g., special exit command or completion marker)

  01KFE2XD (4 days ago by @claude)
    Ralph loop: Treat pending_review tasks as highest priority - agents should validate and complete these before starting new work

  01KFE2XF (4 days ago by @claude)
    Ralph loop: Add --tasks flag to specify explicit task scope (e.g., --tasks @ref1,@ref2) to prevent scope creep beyond target work

  01KFE2XH (4 days ago by @claude)
    Ralph loop: Add progress checkpoint output at each iteration showing completed/in-progress/remaining counts

  01KFEYXF (4 days ago by @claude) [cli, derive, dx]
    Spec-level depends_on field with derive integration - Add --depends-on flag to kspec item set for spec items. When deriving tasks, automatically create task dependencies based on spec dependencies. Example: if @spec-A depends_on @spec-B, then kspec derive @spec-A creates task-A depending on task-B. Removes need to manually set task dependencies after derive.

  01KFEZDX (4 days ago by @claude) [workflow, dx]
    Ephemeral workflow runs - Add support for workflows that don't persist run state. Use cases: simple instruction flows, quick checklists, trivial step sequences. Options: (1) --ephemeral flag on 'workflow start', (2) workflow.ephemeral field in definition, (3) both with override. Ephemeral runs: no file storage, no shadow commits, not shown in 'workflow runs', state only in session context or just sequential display. Reduces noise for simple flows.

  01KFGRV6 (3 days ago by @claude) [reflection, cli, dx]
    Generic --clear-<field> pattern for array fields - Instead of adding --clear-deps, --clear-tags, --clear-blocked-by separately, consider a general pattern like --clear <field> or --<field> [] syntax

  01KFGRVB (3 days ago by @claude) [reflection, workflow, modeling]

Inbox (73 items):

  01KF16XG (1 week ago by @claude)
    Hook for SessionStart or post-compaction to inject relevant context and subtle instructions. Could auto-run 'kspec session start' or similar to give agent fresh context after memory is compacted.

  01KF1V53 (1 week ago by @claude) [workflow, meta]
    Spec review process: 3 parallel agents (internal fit, prior art comparison, external research) before finalizing major specs. Worked well for shadow branch spec design - should be formalized in meta-spec workflows.

  01KF3PJW (1 week ago by @claude) [cli, dx, design]
    CLI output parity - JSON and human-readable outputs can drift when adding features. Investigate patterns to keep them in sync by design: unified output formatter, schema-driven rendering, shared data structure that both modes consume. Current pattern: output(data, humanFormatter) - data goes to JSON, formatter handles human. But formatter can show derived/computed info that isn't in data.

  01KF4DS5 (1 week ago by @claude) [design, tasks, dx]
    Investigate ready task ordering beyond priority - creation order may not be ideal. Consider: recency of notes/activity, dependency depth, spec item priority inheritance, manual ordering field, tags for urgency

  01KF554T (1 week ago by @claude) [automation, workflow, agents]
    Ralph Wiggum / Looper Mode - Create a kspec-integrated autonomous loop runner. Core idea: a script that runs Claude Code repeatedly with fresh context, using a templated prompt that instructs it to:

1. Run 'kspec session start' to see ready tasks
2. Pick a well-defined task (high priority, clear spec, no blockers)
3. Work on it until completion or stuck
4. Commit and complete the task
5. Exit cleanly (the outer loop restarts with fresh context)

Key features from research:
- Simple core: while :; do cat PROMPT.md | claude ; done
- Context persists via filesystem/git, not session memory
- Dual-condition exit: require both completion indicator AND explicit exit signal
- Circuit breaker: stop after N loops with no progress or repeated errors
- Rate limiting for API calls

Kspec-specific additions:
- Task selection heuristics (prioritize: clear AC, no blockers, isolated scope)
- Progress tracking via task notes before each exit
- Session checkpoint before exit to ensure clean state
- Maybe: task budget (only attempt tasks under estimated N turns)

The beauty is each iteration starts fresh but inherits cumulative work. Bad iterations don't compound context - they just waste one run.

  01KF6541 (1 week ago by @claude) [ralph, tui, optional]
    Ralph TUI mode: Optional terminal UI for ralph that provides real-time visualization of agent progress, event stream, session status. Would build on streaming/ACP foundation. Lower priority than core auditability work.

  01KF8TQ5 (6 days ago by @claude) [idea, cli, architecture]

Could help with bulk operations, rollback on errors, and atomic multi-item changes. Challenges: managing state across commands, cleanup on abandoned transactions, shadow branch implications. Maybe simpler approach: explicit 'kspec bulk' command that takes a script/list of operations and executes them atomically.

  01KFMP5R (2 days ago by @claude) [reflection, cli, batch]
    Apply @trait-multi-ref-batch to task set --automation. Enable: kspec task set --refs @a @b @c --automation eligible. Currently must run one command per task.

  01KFMP6G (2 days ago by @claude) [reflection, cli, dx]
    Add kspec task list as alias for kspec tasks. CLI naming consistency - other commands use 'kspec <noun> list' pattern.

  01KFNCZR (1 day ago by @claude)
    Implement X-Request-Id header middleware for all API endpoints (@trait-api-endpoint ac-6). Should generate ULID if not provided, echo if present in request.

  01KFND00 (1 day ago by @claude)
    Convert daemon static analysis tests to real E2E tests that start daemon and make HTTP requests. Current tests verify code structure exists but don't test runtime behavior. Affects: daemon-server.test.ts, daemon-api-tasks.test.ts, future endpoint tests.

  01KFNVB0 (1 day ago by Jacob Chapel)
    Recent notes should cover pending review notes and most recently closed task notes as well, probably separated out with some more organization so it is clear what was being worked on and if there is anything from prior work worth sharing forward (in case its a continuation of the same type of work)

  01KFNVME (1 day ago by Jacob Chapel)
    Need to ensure the pr review merge workflow enforces rechecking at each step and not to just use prior checks before using the workflow as proof. Just saw an agent barrel through the workflow never checking CI status again because it already did and so assumed it was all good even though there were new comments and just merged.

  01KFP9A2 (1 day ago by @claude) [reflection, cli, tasks]
    Add --depends-on flag to 'kspec task add' - Set task dependencies at creation time instead of requiring follow-up 'task set' or manual YAML edit. Small scope: single flag addition. Surfaced when creating 10 E2E tasks that all depend on infrastructure setup task.

  01KFP9A6 (1 day ago by @claude) [reflection, cli, testing]
    Test coverage report command: 'kspec coverage @spec-ref' - Scan codebase for '// AC: @spec ac-N' annotations and report which ACs have test coverage vs gaps. Helps verify all acceptance criteria are tested. Medium scope. Surfaced when manually cross-referencing 33 @web-dashboard ACs against test tasks.

  01KFP9A9 (1 day ago by @claude) [reflection, planning, shadow]
    First-party plan support with shadow branch storage - Store plan documents in kspec shadow branch (e.g., .kspec/plans/) and link them to derived tasks. Plans persist across sessions, provide implementation context without embedding in notes. Could integrate with Claude Code plan mode workflow. Medium scope. Surfaced when plan file at ~/.claude/plans/ wouldn't persist for future sessions.

  01KFPDCY (1 day ago by @claude) [ci, testing, dx]
    Add cross-platform CI matrix testing - run core functionality tests on Windows, macOS, and Linux. Would catch issues like Unix-specific commands (which, cp -r) before they reach PR review. Consider: matrix strategy in GitHub Actions, platform-specific test skips where needed, focus on CLI commands and daemon lifecycle.

  01KFPH36 (1 day ago by @claude) [daemon, typescript, reflection]
    Fix daemon TypeScript strict mode compatibility - add proper types to route handlers, fix Elysia generic issues, eliminate implicit any. Currently daemon source is copied instead of compiled because of these issues. Medium scope.

  01KFPH39 (1 day ago by @claude) [workflow, dx, reflection]
    Add workflow run auto-cleanup - either 'workflow prune' command to remove stale runs, or auto-expire runs older than N days. Prevents accumulation that clutters workflow commands (had 19 active runs). Small scope.

  01KFPH3D (1 day ago by @claude) [daemon, dx, reflection]
    Capture daemon stderr during startup - when daemon fails to start within timeout, show the actual error from stderr instead of just 'failed within 5 seconds'. Small scope, improves debugging experience.

  01KFQ38P (1 day ago by @claude) [e2e, skill, dx]
    Create a skill for adding E2E tests - should guide through creating test file, remind about vitest exclusion, and suggest data-testid patterns

  01KFQ517 (1 day ago by @claude) [e2e, testing, reflection]
    E2E tests: Use isolated port range (not 3456) + cross-platform cleanup. Current approach conflicts with existing daemons. Should use high ephemeral port range and improve cleanup mechanism.

  01KFQ53E (1 day ago by @claude) [dx, daemon, reflection]
    Daemon dev workflow: Either add watch mode (npm run dev:daemon) that auto-copies to dist/, or change to run directly from packages/daemon/src. Currently easy to forget build:daemon step.

  01KFQ586 (1 day ago by @claude) [daemon, dx, reflection]
    Daemon logging: Add --log-file or --verbose option to 'kspec serve start'. Currently stdio is ignored making debugging silent failures difficult. Previous task was cancelled but need remains.

  01KFQ595 (1 day ago by @claude) [daemon, dx, reflection]
    Daemon: Log resolved web UI path and static serving details on startup. Currently logs 'Web UI assets found' but not enough detail to debug hash mismatches like today's issue.

  01KFQ8V8 (1 day ago by @claude) [reflection, daemon, small]
    Auto-set BUN_ENV=production when spawning daemon in serve.ts to prevent Bun dev mode HTML transformation causing asset hash mismatches

  01KFQ8VE (1 day ago by @claude) [reflection, e2e, testing]
    E2E test fixture health check: After starting daemon, verify /api/health returns expected response before running tests. Fail fast with clear error if daemon startup failed.

  01KFQ8VK (1 day ago by @claude) [reflection, cli, trait]
    CLI-wide --kspec-dir option: Add as a trait (cross-cutting) to all CLI commands enabling testing with isolated fixtures and running kspec for different project directories

  01KFQ8VS (1 day ago by @claude) [reflection, docs, small]
    Document Bun production mode requirement: Add note to AGENTS.md about BUN_ENV=production being required for daemon to prevent dev mode HTML transformations

  01KFR0KN (21 hours ago by @claude) [reflection, cli, design]
    Dependency flag design for task set - Current --depends-on replaces all deps. Consider: (1) support multiple --depends-on flags in same call to append, (2) add --add-depends-on variant for explicit append semantics, or (3) both. Needs design to decide approach. Related to existing inbox item @01KFP9A2 for task add.

  01KFR0SJ (21 hours ago by @claude) [documentation, cli, dx]
    Improve CLI feature discoverability documentation - Key features are not well-known: (1) 'kspec item ac add' for adding ACs via CLI instead of editing YAML, (2) 'kspec task set --refs' for batch operations on multiple tasks. Consider: adding examples to AGENTS.md quick reference, improving --help output with common use cases, or adding a 'kspec cheatsheet' command. Agent didn't know these existed and did manual work instead.

  01KFRAJG (18 hours ago by @claude) [cli, dx, reflection]
    Add --relates-to, --implements, --depends-on flags to kspec item set command. Currently relationship fields require manual YAML editing.

  01KFST4D (4 hours ago by @claude) [reflection, templates, testing]
    E2E/UI Task Template with anti-skip guardrails - Frame tasks as 'Implement X validated by tests' not 'Write tests for X'. Include prerequisite checklist (verify testIds exist first), 'No test.skip()' in Definition of Done, example test structure. Prevents documentary test anti-pattern.

  01KFST4F (4 hours ago by @claude) [reflection, cli, validation]
    Task Completion Validation - Add validation when marking task complete: if task has test tags, verify tests pass; warn if PR merged but task not completed. Catches 'PR merged but task pending' pattern.

  01KFST4H (4 hours ago by @claude) [reflection, automation, ralph]
    Automation Eligibility Default Fix - Tasks should not default to 'eligible'. Ralph should only pick up explicitly eligible tasks. Require assessment before automation can claim. Prevents ralph from producing documentary tests on complex/unclear tasks.

  01KFST4K (4 hours ago by @claude) [reflection, ci, workflow]
    PR-Task Linkage Audit - When PR merges with 'Task: @ref' trailer, check if task is still pending and prompt action. Could be CI check or post-merge hook. Catches orphaned tasks after PR merge.

  01KFT2J3 (2 hours ago by @claude) [cli, dx, merge]
    Add 'kspec merge-driver configure' command for existing repos that missed auto-config during init. Would set git config merge.kspec.* and create .gitattributes in shadow branch. Useful for repos initialized before PR #183 or where config was lost.

rawInput.command:
kspec workflow next @01KFTB2P --notes "Session review complete. Identifying high-confidence patterns:

SUCCESSES:
1. AC coverage gap identification workflow worked well - task notes clearly documented gaps, made it easy to pick up and address specific test needs
2. Test-first approach for restart scenarios - creating new manager instances to simulate daemon restart was clean and effective

FRICTION:
1. Workflow run accumulation - had to specify @01KFTAWD for every workflow next call due to 37+ active runs. This is noise pollution.
2. Task automation eligibility unclear - task @01KFQAAX was marked eligible but required judgment call about what 'restart test coverage' meant

Checking against existing state..."

toolResponse.stdout:
OK Completed step 2/4: [action] Identify high-confidence friction points and successes.

HIGH CONFIDENCE criteria (ac-2, ac-4):
- Concrete and specific (not vague)
- Systemic/repeatable (not one-off)
- Clear cause and effect
- Agent has certainty about the pattern

LOW CONFIDENCE (DO NOT capture):
- Vague observations
- Uncertain patterns
- One-off issues
- Hypothetical problems

For each item identified, check against search results from step 1.


Step 3/4: [decision] For each potential item, evaluate against existing state:

AC-3: If matches existing observation/inbox/task -> SKIP IT, note existing ref
AC-4: If unique AND high-confidence -> CAPTURE IT
AC-2: If vague/uncertain -> SKIP IT

Decision matrix:
- Duplicate of existing item -> skip, note reference
- Unique + high confidence -> capture
- Vague/uncertain -> skip silently

    {
      "ref": "01KF554T",
      "text": "Ralph Wiggum / Looper Mode - Create a kspec-integrated autonomous loop runner. Core idea: a script that runs Claude Code repeatedly with fresh context, using a templated prompt that instructs it to:\n\n1. Run 'kspec session start' to see ready tasks\n2. Pick a well-defined task (high priority, clear spec, no blockers)\n3. Work on it until completion or stuck\n4. Commit and complete the task\n5. Exit cleanly (the outer loop restarts with fresh context)\n\nKey features from research:\n- Simple core: while :; do cat PROMPT.md | claude ; done\n- Context persists via filesystem/git, not session memory\n- Dual-condition exit: require both completion indicator AND explicit exit signal\n- Circuit breaker: stop after N loops with no progress or repeated errors\n- Rate limiting for API calls\n\nKspec-specific additions:\n- Task selection heuristics (prioritize: clear AC, no blockers, isolated scope)\n- Progress tracking via task notes before each exit\n- Session checkpoint before exit to ensure clean state\n- Maybe: task budget (only attempt tasks under estimated N turns)\n\nThe beauty is each iteration starts fresh but inherits cumulative work. Bad iterations don't compound context - they just waste one run.",

## Instructions

Run the task-work skill in loop mode:

```
/task-work loop
```

Loop mode means: no confirmations, auto-resolve decisions, automation-eligible tasks only.

Exit when task work is complete or no eligible tasks remain.

availableCommands.description: Comprehensive codebase audit for release readiness. Parallel exploration of docs, code, config, tests, and specs to identify cruft, then interactive triage with clear action options. (project)

availableCommands.description: Create new workflows with consistent structure and matching skill integration. Meta-workflow for formalizing patterns into trackable processes. (project)

availableCommands.name: kspec
availableCommands.description: Use kspec CLI for task and spec management. Invoke when working with tasks, tracking work, capturing ideas, checking session status, or managing specs in this project. (project)

availableCommands.name: local-review
availableCommands.description: Pre-PR quality review - verify AC coverage, test quality, E2E preference, and test isolation. (project)

availableCommands.name: meta
availableCommands.description: Manage session context - focus, threads, questions, and observations. Use when tracking what you're working on, managing parallel work streams, or capturing friction points. (project)

availableCommands.name: pr
availableCommands.description: Create a pull request from current work. Handles branch creation, commits, push, and PR creation. Detects branch protection and guides through the PR workflow. (project)

availableCommands.name: pr-review
availableCommands.description: Review and merge a PR with quality gates. Verifies AC coverage and spec alignment before merge. Used in subagent context. (project)

availableCommands.name: reflect
availableCommands.description: Reflect on a session to identify learnings, friction points, and improvements. Captures valuable insights for future sessions and system evolution. (project)

availableCommands.description: Create versioned releases - bump version via PR, tag, create GitHub release. CI publishes to npm. (project)

availableCommands.name: task-work
availableCommands.description: Work on a kspec task with proper lifecycle - verify, start, note, submit, PR, complete. (project)

availableCommands.name: triage
availableCommands.description: Triage inbox items systematically. Analyzes items against spec/tasks, categorizes them, and processes using spec-first approach with plan mode for larger features. (project)

â”€â”€â”€ Spec Context â”€â”€â”€
Multi-Directory Daemon Architecture
Type: feature
Implementation: in_progress
Description:
  Extends the daemon server to support multiple kspec projects simultaneously from a single
  daemon process. Projects are identified via X-Kspec-Dir HTTP header. Enables E2E testing
  with isolated fixtures and multi-project development workflows.
  
  Key architectural changes:
  - Global daemon with PID/port files at ~/.config/kspec/
  - Project context caching with on-demand registration
  - Per-project file watchers
  - WebSocket connections bound to specific projects
  
  BREAKING CHANGE: PID/port files move from .kspec/.daemon.pid to ~/.config/kspec/daemon.pid
Acceptance Criteria:
  [ac-1]
    Given: daemon is running
    When: request includes X-Kspec-Dir header with valid absolute path
    Then: daemon uses that project's context for the request
  [ac-2]
    Given: daemon started from directory with .kspec/
    When: request has no X-Kspec-Dir header
    Then: daemon uses startup directory's project as default
  [ac-3]
    Given: daemon started from directory without .kspec/
    When: request without X-Kspec-Dir arrives
    Then: return 400 with error "No default project configured. Specify X-Kspec-Dir header."
  [ac-4]
    Given: request specifies unknown project path
    When: path is valid kspec project
    Then: daemon auto-registers and caches project context
  [ac-5]
    Given: request specifies invalid path (no .kspec/)
    When: request processed
    Then: return 400 with error "Invalid kspec project - .kspec/ not found at <path>"
  [ac-6]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir header value
    When: path is relative
    Then: reject with 400 and error "Path must be absolute"
  [ac-7]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir header value
    When: path contains ".." segments
    Then: reject with 400 and error "Path must not contain parent traversal"
  [ac-8]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir header value
    When: normalized path differs from provided path
    Then: use normalized path for registration (resolve "." segments, remove trailing slashes, do NOT resolve symlinks)
  [ac-8b]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir points to path with insufficient read permissions
    When: request processed
    Then: return 403 with error "Permission denied - cannot read <path>"
  [ac-9]
    Given: no daemon running
    When: kspec serve start runs from any directory
    Then: daemon starts and writes PID to ~/.config/kspec/daemon.pid and port to ~/.config/kspec/daemon.port
  [ac-9b]
    Given: ~/.config/kspec/ does not exist
    When: daemon starts
    Then: create directory with mode 0755 before writing PID/port files
  [ac-9c]
    Given: ~/.config/kspec/daemon.port exists but contains invalid content
    When: CLI reads port
    Then: return error "Invalid daemon port file" and suggest "kspec serve stop && kspec serve start"
  [ac-10]
    Given: daemon running on port 3456
    When: kspec serve start runs from different directory
    Then: command exits with success and outputs "Daemon already running on port 3456" (no second instance started)
  [ac-10b]
    Given: two kspec serve start commands run concurrently (neither has written PID yet)
    When: both check for running daemon
    Then: only one daemon starts (use file lock on PID file)
  [ac-11]
    Given: daemon running
    When: kspec serve stop runs from any directory
    Then: daemon stops and removes global PID and port files
  [ac-12]
    Given: daemon running
    When: kspec serve status runs
    Then: shows daemon status with port, uptime, and list of registered projects with their paths
  [ac-13]
    Given: CLI needs to connect to daemon
    When: daemon is running
    Then: CLI reads port from ~/.config/kspec/daemon.port
  [ac-14]
    Given: daemon restarts
    When: first request for a project arrives
    Then: project is re-registered automatically (same as initial registration)
  [ac-15]
    Given: daemon running with registered projects
    When: daemon restarts
    Then: registered project list is empty (no persistence across restarts)
  [ac-16]
    Given: two concurrent requests for unregistered project with same path
    When: processed
    Then: both succeed and share the same registered project context (no duplicate watchers)
  [ac-17]
    Given: project is registered
    When: files change in project's .kspec/
    Then: file watcher triggers events scoped to that project
  [ac-18]
    Given: multiple projects registered
    When: Project A changes
    Then: only Project A's WebSocket subscribers receive updates
  [ac-19]
    Given: project watcher creation fails due to OS limits (ulimit)
    When: error occurs
    Then: project registration fails with 503 and error "Unable to watch project - resource limit reached"
  [ac-20]
    Given: registered project's .kspec/ directory is deleted
    When: next request arrives for that project
    Then: return 404 and unregister project automatically
  [ac-21]
    Given: WebSocket client connects with X-Kspec-Dir header during handshake
    When: connection established
    Then: connection is bound to that project for its lifetime and only receives events from that project
  [ac-21b]
    Given: WebSocket connection is established and bound to project
    When: client attempts to change project
    Then: project binding is immutable - client must disconnect and reconnect with new header
  [ac-22]
    Given: WebSocket client connects without X-Kspec-Dir header
    When: default project exists
    Then: connection is bound to default project
  [ac-23]
    Given: WebSocket client connects without X-Kspec-Dir header
    When: no default project
    Then: connection is rejected with close code 4000 and reason "No project specified"
  [ac-24]
    Given: multi-project mode
    When: any API endpoint is called
    Then: response data is scoped to the request's project (no cross-project data leakage)
  [ac-25]
    Given: web UI loads
    When: more than one project registered
    Then: project selector is shown listing all registered projects
  [ac-26]
    Given: user selects project in UI
    When: selection changes
    Then: all subsequent API requests include that project's path in X-Kspec-Dir header
  [ac-27]
    Given: UI is showing project data
    When: different project selected
    Then: UI reloads data from newly selected project
  [ac-28]
    Given: GET /api/projects
    When: called
    Then: returns list of registered projects with paths, registration time, and watcher status
  [ac-29]
    Given: POST /api/projects
    When: called with {path string} body
    Then: manually registers a project (for explicit registration use cases)
  [ac-30]
    Given: DELETE /api/projects/:encodedPath
    When: called
    Then: unregisters project and stops its file watcher
  [ac-8c]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir header contains symlinked path
    When: path resolves to same directory as another registered project via symlink
    Then: paths are treated as separate projects (symlinks are NOT resolved during normalization)
  [ac-20b]
    Given: daemon started from directory with .kspec/ which is later deleted
    When: request without X-Kspec-Dir arrives after default project .kspec/ deleted
    Then: return 400 with error 'Default project no longer valid. Specify X-Kspec-Dir header.'
  [ac-11b]
    Given: daemon is shutting down
    When: shutdown signal received
    Then: all project watchers are stopped and all WebSocket connections are closed before process exits

- AC-21b: Project binding is immutable - client must disconnect and reconnect to change project
- AC-22: WebSocket without header + default project exists â†’ bound to default project
- AC-23: WebSocket without header + no default project â†’ rejected with close code 4000

- AC-21b: Immutable binding - verify changing project is rejected
- AC-22: Default project fallback - verify binding when no header
- AC-23: Reject when no project - verify close code 4000

Update: tests/daemon-websocket.test.ts (replace documentary tests with real ones)

- [ ] All 4 ACs have passing tests

  [ac-1] (from @trait-localhost-security)
    Given: server is starting
    When: binding to network interface
    Then: only accepts connections from 127.0.0.1 and ::1 (IPv6 localhost)
  [ac-2] (from @trait-localhost-security)
    Given: connection attempt from non-localhost
    When: request received
    Then: connection rejected with 403 Forbidden
  [ac-3] (from @trait-localhost-security)
    Given: server is configured

  [ac-1] (from @trait-websocket-protocol)
    Given: WebSocket connection is established
    When: client connects
    Then: server assigns unique connection ID and sends connected event with session_id
  [ac-2] (from @trait-websocket-protocol)
    Given: client wants notifications
    When: subscribe command sent with topics array
    Then: server tracks subscription and sends ack with request_id
  [ac-3] (from @trait-websocket-protocol)
    Given: client is subscribed to topic
    When: relevant change occurs
    Then: server broadcasts event with format {msg_id, seq, timestamp, topic, event, data}
  [ac-4] (from @trait-websocket-protocol)
    Given: WebSocket connection is active
    When: 30 seconds pass without activity
    Then: server sends ping frame
  [ac-5] (from @trait-websocket-protocol)
    Given: ping was sent
    When: no pong received within 90 seconds
    Then: connection is closed with code 1001
  [ac-6] (from @trait-websocket-protocol)
    Given: server sends events
    When: client cannot keep up (backpressure)
    Then: server pauses non-critical broadcasts until drain event
  [ac-7] (from @trait-websocket-protocol)
    Given: connection is closing
    When: close initiated
    Then: use code 1000 for clean close, 1001 for timeout, 1011 for error
  [ac-8] (from @trait-websocket-protocol)
    Given: client reconnects after disconnect
    When: new connection established
    Then: client resets sequence tracking (lastSeqProcessed = -1) since server generates new sequence

OK Started task: 01KFQADD

--- Spec Context ---
Implementing: Multi-Directory Daemon Architecture

Extends the daemon server to support multiple kspec projects simultaneously from a single
daemon process. Projects are identified via X-Kspec-Dir HTTP header. Enables E2E testing
with isolated fixtures and multi-project development workflows.

Key architectural changes:
- Global daemon with PID/port files at ~/.config/kspec/
- Project context caching with on-demand registration
- Per-project file watchers
- WebSocket connections bound to specific projects

BREAKING CHANGE: PID/port files move from .kspec/.daemon.pid to ~/.config/kspec/daemon.pid


Acceptance Criteria (38):
  [ac-1]
    Given: daemon is running
    When: request includes X-Kspec-Dir header with valid absolute path
    Then: daemon uses that project's context for the request
  [ac-2]
    Given: daemon started from directory with .kspec/
    When: request has no X-Kspec-Dir header
    Then: daemon uses startup directory's project as default
  [ac-3]
    Given: daemon started from directory without .kspec/
    When: request without X-Kspec-Dir arrives
    Then: return 400 with error "No default project configured. Specify X-Kspec-Dir header."
  [ac-4]
    Given: request specifies unknown project path
    When: path is valid kspec project
    Then: daemon auto-registers and caches project context
  [ac-5]
    Given: request specifies invalid path (no .kspec/)
    When: request processed
    Then: return 400 with error "Invalid kspec project - .kspec/ not found at <path>"
  [ac-6]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir header value
    When: path is relative
    Then: reject with 400 and error "Path must be absolute"
  [ac-7]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir header value
    When: path contains ".." segments
    Then: reject with 400 and error "Path must not contain parent traversal"
  [ac-8]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir header value
    When: normalized path differs from provided path
    Then: use normalized path for registration (resolve "." segments, remove trailing slashes, do NOT resolve symlinks)
  [ac-8b]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir points to path with insufficient read permissions
    When: request processed
    Then: return 403 with error "Permission denied - cannot read <path>"
  [ac-9]
    Given: no daemon running
    When: kspec serve start runs from any directory
    Then: daemon starts and writes PID to ~/.config/kspec/daemon.pid and port to ~/.config/kspec/daemon.port
  [ac-9b]
    Given: ~/.config/kspec/ does not exist
    When: daemon starts
    Then: create directory with mode 0755 before writing PID/port files
  [ac-9c]
    Given: ~/.config/kspec/daemon.port exists but contains invalid content
    When: CLI reads port
    Then: return error "Invalid daemon port file" and suggest "kspec serve stop && kspec serve start"
  [ac-10]
    Given: daemon running on port 3456
    When: kspec serve start runs from different directory
    Then: command exits with success and outputs "Daemon already running on port 3456" (no second instance started)
  [ac-10b]
    Given: two kspec serve start commands run concurrently (neither has written PID yet)
    When: both check for running daemon
    Then: only one daemon starts (use file lock on PID file)
  [ac-11]
    Given: daemon running
    When: kspec serve stop runs from any directory
    Then: daemon stops and removes global PID and port files
  [ac-12]
    Given: daemon running
    When: kspec serve status runs
    Then: shows daemon status with port, uptime, and list of registered projects with their paths
  [ac-13]
    Given: CLI needs to connect to daemon
    When: daemon is running
    Then: CLI reads port from ~/.config/kspec/daemon.port
  [ac-14]
    Given: daemon restarts
    When: first request for a project arrives
    Then: project is re-registered automatically (same as initial registration)
  [ac-15]
    Given: daemon running with registered projects
    When: daemon restarts
    Then: registered project list is empty (no persistence across restarts)
  [ac-16]
    Given: two concurrent requests for unregistered project with same path
    When: processed
    Then: both succeed and share the same registered project context (no duplicate watchers)
  [ac-17]
    Given: project is registered
    When: files change in project's .kspec/
    Then: file watcher triggers events scoped to that project
  [ac-18]
    Given: multiple projects registered
    When: Project A changes
    Then: only Project A's WebSocket subscribers receive updates
  [ac-19]
    Given: project watcher creation fails due to OS limits (ulimit)
    When: error occurs
    Then: project registration fails with 503 and error "Unable to watch project - resource limit reached"
  [ac-20]
    Given: registered project's .kspec/ directory is deleted
    When: next request arrives for that project
    Then: return 404 and unregister project automatically
  [ac-21]
    Given: WebSocket client connects with X-Kspec-Dir header during handshake
    When: connection established
    Then: connection is bound to that project for its lifetime and only receives events from that project
  [ac-21b]
    Given: WebSocket connection is established and bound to project
    When: client attempts to change project
    Then: project binding is immutable - client must disconnect and reconnect with new header
  [ac-22]
    Given: WebSocket client connects without X-Kspec-Dir header
    When: default project exists
    Then: connection is bound to default project
  [ac-23]
    Given: WebSocket client connects without X-Kspec-Dir header
    When: no default project
    Then: connection is rejected with close code 4000 and reason "No project specified"
  [ac-24]
    Given: multi-project mode
    When: any API endpoint is called
    Then: response data is scoped to the request's project (no cross-project data leakage)
  [ac-25]
    Given: web UI loads
    When: more than one project registered
    Then: project selector is shown listing all registered projects
  [ac-26]
    Given: user selects project in UI
    When: selection changes
    Then: all subsequent API requests include that project's path in X-Kspec-Dir header
  [ac-27]
    Given: UI is showing project data
    When: different project selected
    Then: UI reloads data from newly selected project
  [ac-28]
    Given: GET /api/projects
    When: called
    Then: returns list of registered projects with paths, registration time, and watcher status
  [ac-29]
    Given: POST /api/projects
    When: called with {path string} body
    Then: manually registers a project (for explicit registration use cases)
  [ac-30]
    Given: DELETE /api/projects/:encodedPath
    When: called
    Then: unregisters project and stops its file watcher
  [ac-8c]
    Given: X-Kspec-Dir header contains symlinked path
    When: path resolves to same directory as another registered project via symlink
    Then: paths are treated as separate projects (symlinks are NOT resolved during normalization)
  [ac-20b]
    Given: daemon started from directory with .kspec/ which is later deleted
    When: request without X-Kspec-Dir arrives after default project .kspec/ deleted
    Then: return 400 with error 'Default project no longer valid. Specify X-Kspec-Dir header.'
  [ac-11b]
    Given: daemon is shutting down
    When: shutdown signal received
    Then: all project watchers are stopped and all WebSocket connections are closed before process exits

Remember: Add test coverage for each AC and mark tests with // AC: @spec-ref ac-N

Or add acceptance criteria for new features.
